title: whirlwindmoney

comments.author: whirlwindmoney
comments.created_time: March 28, 2023, 01:34:49 AMLast edit: May 05, 2023, 06:18:59 AM by whirlwindmoney
comments.body: Anonymity Mining campaign is live!What is Anonymity Mining, how does it work and why is it needed?In order to achieve privacy, Whirlwind uses a multi-sig that acts as a pool and consolidates all deposited Bitcoin. Once funds are withdrawn by a completely new address from this pool, the on-chain link between the source and destination is severed, thus anonymising the withdrawn Bitcoin.The goal of this pattern is to aggregate different deposits into a single pool, such that distinguishing between them becomes unfeasible. The only factor to keep in mind is that this pattern is useless if there are not many deposits of varying sizes, such that the set of probable suspects is too small. We aim to overcome this issue by launching the Anonymity Mining campaign. The more people use Whirlwind, the more secure it becomes for everyone. We will consider the bootstrapping phase over when the Anonymity Set crosses 10,000 deposits.Anonymity mining is an incentive to increase the level of privacy Whirlwind offers by rewarding participants with Bitcoin dependent on the deposited amount and how long they keep their assets in the pool. The campaign will run for a limited time until the Anonymity Set hits 10,000 deposits and it will be structured in the following way: In return for increasing the Anonymity Set Whirlwind rewards all funded Notes with 1% monthly interest on their balance. The rewards will be paid out automatically on a daily basis and they are withdrawable anytime. All you need to do in order to participate in the campaign is make a deposit and wait for as long as you want to accrue rewards before withdrawing.Example: If the multi-sig’s average balance during a month is 100BTC Whirlwind will pay out 1BTC in rewards during that month on a daily basis. 1BTC/30 days = 0.03333BTC paid out daily. If you have a Note with a balance of 1BTC you will receive 1% of 0.03333BTC which is 0.000333BTC every day.It’s important to emphasize that the rewards will be paid out from our personal reserve and only for a limited amount of time until the Anonymity set passes the 10,000 deposits threshold, at which point incentives won’t be needed anymore. We will monitor the progress and make adjustments if needed.

comments.body: StatusClearnet - onlineTor V3 - onlineChangelog04.02.2023 11:30:00 PM UTC-DDoS protection readjustments04.04.2023 06:00:00 AM UTC-Fees were reduced from 0.00015BTC/address to 0.0001BTC/address-Website is now fully responsive-All "unclickable" buttons fixed-Note can now be downloaded in the same way as the Letter of Guarantee-Tor header added-HTTP Strict-Transport-Security added-Captcha can be refreshed-Clearnet link added to footer-Added warning on the Withdraw Note/Combine Note pages (Your note will only work after the deposit is fully confirmed.)-If user doesen't have JS enabled an error will be displayed-Sliders fixed-Network fees now adjust automatically based on market conditions so transactions shouldn't get stuck anymore04.05.2023 08:00:00 PM UTC-Address input now shows the beginning and end of your address-Loading screen implemented-Clearnet stability issues should be solved-Made changes to network fee system - we will lower the costs to the end user in the next days-Refresh captcha added for Note too-Refresh transactions fixed04.09.2023 00:00:00 AM UTC-Fee is now optional and will be treated as a donation, you can choose any amount between 0% and 4%-Withdraw fee for each output address was lowered by another 25% from 0.0001BTC to 0.000075BTC-Most of clearnet stability issues solved - still actively monitoring and testing-Frontend responsive on mobile-Backend-signers connection issues solved (the reason some withdrawals were delayed)-FAQ updated04.10.2023 00:02:00 AM UTC-Anonymity set is now displayed on the website-DDoS protection parameters adjusted, clearnet should be more stable now-Edited menu and footer04.13.2023 10:00:00 PM UTC-Stability issues should now be fixed-Illustrations downsized for faster loading-Added warning to save the Letter of Guarantee received after each withdraw from Notes-Transaction queue is still visible after you withdraw from a Note (page refreshed automatically before)-Withdraw note 'Continue' fixed, not clickable anymore if a Note is not introduced04.15.2023 02:00:00 AM UTC-Added support for all types of Bitcoin addresses-Input boxes cursor fixed-Alert while backend is down for maintenance-Minor UI fixes04.22.2023 01:00:00 AM UTC-Pay to Note feature implemented enabling instant, feeless and anonymous Bitcoin transactions.-Complete compliance module - Whirlwind provides a signed Guarantee Letter for every action executed by the end user. It's the end user's responsibility to save all the guarantee letters and use them as needed.-new UI and FAQ for better user experience-stability issues completely fixed, all delay times will be respected to the minute-withdraw fees are reduced to 2500 sats/address from 7500 sats/address-fast mode is deprecated, everyone will have to use the Note system. you will still be able to withdraw instantly after your deposit is confirmed so it can be used in the same way as the fast mode-outputs are now fungible, namely 0.001BTC, 0.005BTC, 0.01BTC, 0.05BTC, 0.1BTC, 0.5BTC, 1BTC, 10BTC. the unspent balance will remain on the Note and you can withdraw it at any time04.24.2023 04:00:00 PM UTC-UI changes for a better user experience-Website now fully responsive for all devices-Donation button introduced on the Dashboard page-Info buttons updated with better directions04.27.2023 01:30:00 AM UTC-Clearnet is online and stable-Clearnet end-to-end encryption implemented-Withdraw fees lowered to 0 - Whirlwind is now free to use unless you choose to donate04.28.2023 01:30:00 AM UTC-Improved UX-Implemented alerts for all completed actions/errors-Updated output size options: 0.001BTC, 0.0025BTC, 0.005BTC, 0.01BTC, 0.025BTC, 0.05BTC, 0.1BTC, 0.25BTC, 0.5BTC, 1BTC, 2.5BTC, 5BTC-Withdraws are now sent once an hour instead of 2 times an hour-Cloudflare tweaked and should now be less annoying, our custom encryption works exactly as intended05.04.2023 03:30:00 AM UTC-Anonymity Mining campaign went live-Updated FAQ-Minor UI issues fixed

comments.author: MusaMohamed
comments.body: I checked your website with onion site. You have two options to select the deposit type: Fast and Note.With Fast option, there is a Receiver's BTC address. Why not implement it similarly as with Note. May you explain about it, differences between Fast and Note options and why only with Fast option, there is an entry box for Receiver's BTC address. Can both use same method as Note?With receiver's BTC address and user login data (I guess your platform will store that data before one mixing is completed and even after that), it can be a risk factor for user privacy.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: I've tried visiting your site to get a proper understanding and the DNS .Money doesn't work on any browser I tried. Only got a break through using Onion link on Tor Browser. Isn't this a problem that should be checked? At least, it should have a wide range of access...The site is rather simple and that's cool but, there needs to be little information on Combine and Withdrawal notes, both to serve as an eye opener to users who would be using the service for the first time and a whole other information on how to use it.Informations like deposit or withdrawal limits amongst others are not provided. Little but, much needed notes as these could be helpful to prospective users.

I visited this mixer site and it runs smoothly on my TOR browser, the service fee options are also very attractive with a minimum of 0.25% and a maximum of 4%.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: It is nice having you here. I see you have a good project merely looking at your announcement thread coupled with the excellent User Interface. I tried accessing your website but to no avail even after using the tor browser still persists. Other mixers I have used grants me direct access. Just like @smartvirus has said, their should be a wider range of access to your website for easy interaction.Unlike other mixers that makes delay optional for users as a result of protecting their identity and granting them privacy which varies based on the delay or time option you choose to get your bitcoin after mixing and the delay mixing time goes with certain percentage of fee payment having it in mind that the more the time delay in mixing, the more your privacy is guaranteed. Just as I have said, is it still applicable to your mixer as it is above? I could not access your website to read further so I had to ask you this question compared to my experience with other mixers.

comments.author: whirlwindmoney
comments.body: Clearnet version is online at whirlwind.money. Please keep in mind that we are not using cloudflare/ddos guard and never will since we believe it's inappropriate for a platform of this type (regardless if we assume the end-user takes proper security precautions), so the clearnet link may be down at times. We implemented a custom protection, but there is only so much you can do without a CDN. If the clearnet link is unavailable please use the Tor version, there shouldn't be any issues with that at any point unless we announce maintenance beforehand.Quote from: MusaMohamed on March 28, 2023, 02:49:55 AMI checked your website with onion site. You have two options to select the deposit type: Fast and Note.With Fast option, there is a Receiver's BTC address. Why not implement it similarly as with Note. May you explain about it, differences between Fast and Note options and why only with Fast option, there is an entry box for Receiver's BTC address. Can both use same method as Note?With receiver's BTC address and user login data (I guess your platform will store that data before one mixing is completed and even after that), it can be a risk factor for user privacy.With Fast mode you select all parameters (receiver BTC address, delay, % distribution for each receiver address) from the beginning, and once you send BTC to our address the system will automatically distribute the BTC according to your inputs without requiring any further action from your side.With Note mode you only need to send BTC to our address, and then at any point in time later you can go to "Withdraw Note", select all parameters (receiver BTC address, delay, % distribution for each receiver address) and then the system will automatically distribute the BTC according to your inputs.We recommend using Note mode because it's more versatile and it helps strenghten the privacy set for the whole mixer. Our competitors only offer a fixed maximum delay (<200 hours) from the moment you deposited to the outgoing transaction, and that makes it easier to track addresses using blockchain analysis. Also with our competitors as far as I am aware it's not possible to have outputs bigger than inputs, which again makes it easier to track things. We don't have these limitations thanks to the Note mode, there is no "expiration date" and you can combine 2 or more Notes to add up their balances together (for example you can deposit 0.1BTC from an address, 0.1BTC from another address, combine the notes, and then withdraw 0.2BTC to a new address.) With these additions from blockchain analysis perspective any outgoing transaction from Whirlwind could have originated from any deposit to Whirlwind, so the privacy will only become stronger as time goes on.Quote from: SatoPrincess on March 28, 2023, 07:47:03 AMI love the simplicity of the website. I would like if there was more information in the FAQ like is there a minimum deposit amount? What’s the log policy? I will be checking for future updates and I hope this mixer can build a good reputation in this bitcoin community.Minimum deposit is 0.001BTCFor Fast mode we keep logs for the first 24 hours (while the deposit address is active), after those hours pass everything is deleted. Even if your outgoing transaction exceeds the 24 hour period, we only know where to send the BTC, but not where they came from.For Note mode we only keep the public key and the amount, nothing about where the deposit originates from or where the balance gets sent to.There is no way for me to prove what I just said about logs, and neither can any other competitor, so that's why we came up with a solution to this problem. The only issue with it is that it requires some help from the community, I am willing to take steps in that direction as soon as it becomes possible to do so. Please see this discussion for more technical info - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5444933.0Quote from: CryptSafe on March 28, 2023, 08:02:34 AMUnlike other mixers that makes delay optional for users as a result of protecting their identity and granting them privacy which varies based on the delay or time option you choose to get your bitcoin after mixing and the delay mixing time goes with certain percentage of fee payment having it in mind that the more the time delay in mixing, the more your privacy is guaranteed. Just as I have said, is it still applicable to your mixer as it is above? For Fast mode there is a 200 hour delay limit, if you use Note mode there are no limits of any sort, you have full control over the process.Quote from: T3PR00T on March 28, 2023, 08:26:19 PMThe mentions multi sig system, is it already implemented? I think it's not yet, in the case it's giving a false information.Nice Ann design.We are in the trust business, if we'd lie about something like this then we have no place doing what we do. You can read more about the multi-sig setup in the other thread I started.

comments.author: RapTarX
comments.body: Quote from: whirlwindmoney on March 28, 2023, 01:34:49 AMMore BTC will be added to the reserve in the following days, for technical info concerning the current setup and our future plans please read this thread.What did you mean by that? More BTC as bankroll? We don't have a way to verify that, do we? If we don't have, the point of this message has no value. Nevertheless, I didn't mean criticism. I was just curious about what you meant.What's the maximum amount you would allow to be mixed? I haven't seen any such info on the website. Good to see that you haven't set cloudfare on the clearnet.

comments.author: whirlwindmoney
comments.body: Quote from: RapTarX on March 28, 2023, 10:54:53 PMQuote from: whirlwindmoney on March 28, 2023, 01:34:49 AMMore BTC will be added to the reserve in the following days, for technical info concerning the current setup and our future plans please read this thread.What did you mean by that? More BTC as bankroll? We don't have a way to verify that, do we? If we don't have, the point of this message has no value. Nevertheless, I didn't mean criticism. I was just curious about what you meant.Yes that's what I meant, and given how the mixer works everyone can verify the reserve at any time since it's held in the multi-sig and that is public.Quote from: RapTarX on March 28, 2023, 10:54:53 PMWhat's the maximum amount you would allow to be mixed? I haven't seen any such info on the website. Good to see that you haven't set cloudfare on the clearnet.It depends how you look at it. If you want to get your BTC back fast (0-200 hours), then you need to consider how much BTC is held in the pool. I don't expect to get any big transactions in the first days at least so this amount is around 1.5BTC right now and will get up to 5-10BTC in a matter of hours which should be enough  while users test the service. We will increase this again once we start to see some transactions happening.On the other hand if you don't care about getting your BTC back fast, but care more about privacy, then you can deposit and get a Note, which you could withdraw at a later time. And for that I don't necessarily think there is a limit since you can withdraw little by little over whatever period you want. Of course trust will play a big role here especially because we are new, so this is why at the same time I will also be looking for trusted members to add to the multi-sig in order to make the service trustless. (read more about this here - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5444933.0)

comments.author: whirlwindmoney
comments.body: Quote from: LeGaulois on March 29, 2023, 12:01:18 PM@whirlwindmoney, Hi.Just to let you know.While trying the onion service yesterday, I got a pop up with the message like "sorry, an error occurred".I have been able to duplicate the message twice but then it was fine on my end.Reading @RapTarX I suppose the clearnet version is now avalaible? Because I get a timer of 5 seconds and then get HTTP ERROR 500Welcome to the niche. More mixers there are, better it is. Hi, thanks for letting me know. This may happen if you manually stop the page from loading or refresh before loading is completed, but it's not an issue even if that happens.The 5 second countdown is normal, it's related to the ddos protection.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: We all know what happened with one big mixer recently and reading reports we could see that authorities seized a lot of coins and other data stored on 7TB drives.There is a lot of competition for remaining mixers and there is certainly demand for bitcoin mixing, but it's hard for me to trust any new mixer.I know it takes time for this, so I hope you will remain active in bitcointalk forum in future.My question is, what is Whirlwind.money doing differently that will prevent something like this happening for you in future, and do you store coins in hot or cold wallets?I see that you are using multisig setup, and I like this approach, but are Notes ever stored anywhere online by you or not?
